Package fr.sorbonne_u.components.pre.controlflowhelpers

Class AbstractContinuation<ParameterType>

  • java.lang.Object
    • fr.sorbonne_u.components.AbstractComponent.AbstractTask
      • fr.sorbonne_u.components.pre.controlflowhelpers.AbstractContinuation<ParameterType>
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ComponentI.ComponentTask, ContinuationI<ParameterType>, Runnable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    AbstractLocalContinuation, AbstractRemoteContinuation
    public abstract class AbstractContinuation<ParameterType>
extends AbstractComponent.AbstractTask
implements ContinuationI<ParameterType>
    The abstract class AbstractContinuation implements the baseline methods for the component model continuation-passing style

    Description

    To use the continuation-passing style, a method must declare a continuation parameter of type AbstractContinuation<ParameterType> with the desired parameter type. Then, to call the method a continuation must be created as a concrete subclass of AbstractContinuation<ParameterType> that implements the protected abstract method runWith. This method receives as actual parameter the value computed before and defines in its body the rest of the computation, including most of the time a previous continuation to be activated.

    Two calling protocol can be used on continuations. If the programmer want to execute a continuation within the same thread as the one that executes the method in which the continuation is called, then he/she uses the method runWith. If he/she wants to execute the continuation as a different task, for example to release the component thread before calling the continuation, then he/she uses to method applyTo, which memorises the continuation parameter and returns a component request that must be executed through a call to handleRequest or handleRequestAsync.

    Invariant

     invariant              true

    Created on : 2018-03-21

    Author:
    Jacques Malenfant
